item.title: 伦敦金融城对工党赢得大选的前景感到宽慰
item.description: 在伦敦金融城，高管们期待着即将到来的大选，希望在经历了几年的动荡之后，大选能为他们带来一个明朗的机会。【原文：In the City of London, executives are looking forward to the imminent general election as a chance for clarity after a turbulent few years.】

item.title: 哈格里夫斯-兰斯当（Hargreaves Lansdown）发售聚焦英国财富管理公司 M&A
item.description: 哈格里夫斯-兰斯当公司（Hargreaves Lansdown Plc）决定拒绝一组投资者的收购要约，这使英国财富管理公司成为焦点，因为周四伦敦一些同行的股价出现上涨。【原文：Hargreaves Lansdown Plc’s decision to reject a takeover offer from a group of investors is putting British wealth managers in the spotlight as shares of some of its peers rallied on Thursday in London.】

item.title: 维勒鲁瓦称，数据公布后欧洲央行仍将在 6 月降息
item.description: 法国央行行长弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）表示，欧洲央行仍然相信通胀正在缓解，足以在6月份降息，而且不应过度解读工资数据。【原文：The European Central Bank remains confident that inflation is easing enough for a June interest-rate cut and shouldn’t over-interpret data on wages, Bank of France Governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau said.】

item.title: 国债收益率大幅走高，交易员认为美联储稍后将首次减息
item.description: 由于显示美国商业活动强劲和劳动力市场紧张的数据引发交易员将美联储降息时间推迟到今年年底，国债收益率飙升。【原文：Treasury yields surged as data showing strength in US business activity and a tight labor market sparked traders to push back the timing for Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts until the end of this year.】

item.title: 私人信贷现金过多却无处安放
item.description: 私人信贷的历史性增长正在造成一个大多数资产经理都希望解决的问题：库房里有太多现金。【原文：Private credit’s historic rise is creating a problem that most asset managers would love to have: too much cash in their coffers.】

item.title: 摩根大通称墨西哥 "超级比索 "对冲美国大选风险
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：The US elections in November could cause more volatility for the Mexican peso than the upcoming vote at home, and investors should seek protection through a derivatives trade, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.】

item.title: 华尔街的现实："这是 Nvidia 的世界，其他人都在付租金
item.description:
"这是 1995 年的时刻，而不是 1999 年的时刻"，Wedbush 的丹-艾夫斯说

。【原文：

‘This is a 1995 moment, not a 1999 moment,’ Wedbush’s Dan Ives says

】

item.title: 债务忧虑加剧，债券几十年来领先黄金的优势消失殆尽
item.description: 在过去半个世纪的大部分时间里，作为一种买入并持有的投资方式，美国国债的收益率一直遥遥领先于黄金。现在，债券作为最终避风港的地位正面临着最大的挑战之一。【原文：For much of the past half century, US Treasuries have handily outpaced gold as a buy-and-hold investment. Now, bonds’ status as the ultimate haven is facing one of its biggest challenges yet.】

item.title: 戈尔曼将于年底卸任摩根士丹利董事长一职
item.description: 詹姆斯-戈尔曼（James Gorman）将于年底卸任摩根士丹利董事长一职，他在摩根士丹利近二十年的经营中，将公司从失败的边缘拯救出来，并将其打造成财富管理巨头。【原文：James Gorman will cede his role as Morgan Stanley chairman at year-end, capping a nearly two-decade run at the firm in which he rescued it from the brink of failure and turned it into a wealth-management powerhouse.】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司肯布尔债务谈判陷入僵局，英国投票呼之欲出
item.description: 据知情人士透露，在英国首相苏纳克（Rishi Sunak）宣布大选之后，泰晤士水务有限公司（Thames Water Ltd. ）母公司与其债权人之间的谈判实际上已经冻结。【原文：Talks between Thames Water Ltd.’s parent company and its creditors are effectively frozen after UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak called a general election, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦与国际货币基金组织关于新贷款的初步会谈将于 5 月 24 日结束：官员
item.description: 在双方官员讨论了即将到来的预算提案之后，巴基斯坦和国际货币基金组织将于明天结束为期两周的新贷款初步谈判。【原文：Pakistan and the International Monetary Fund will end two weeks of initial talks for a new loan tomorrow after the officials from the two sides discussed proposals for the upcoming budget.】

item.title: 陷入困境的 Segantii 可在五天内退出 97% 的投资组合
item.description: 西蒙-萨德勒（Simon Sadler）的塞甘蒂资本管理公司（Segantii Capital Management）因内幕交易指控于周四突然决定向投资者返还资本，该公司可以在五个交易日内清算绝大部分赌注。【原文：Simon Sadler’s Segantii Capital Management, which abruptly decided to return capital to investors on Thursday amid an insider trading charge, can liquidate the vast majority of its bets within five trading days.】

item.title: 波兰炼油企业 Orlen 因新任首席执行官 Fafara 未能说服投资者接受其愿景而暴跌
item.description: 波兰最大的能源公司创下六个月来最大跌幅，因为投资者希望新的管理团队在第一季度盈利未达预期后明确支出情况。【原文：Poland’s largest energy company slumped the most in six months as investors sought clarity from the new management team about spending after first-quarter earnings missed estimates.】

item.title: 外国人正以创纪录的速度涌入土耳其里拉债券市场
item.description: 上周，外国投资者扩大了以里拉计价的土耳其政府债券的购买量，创下了土耳其国内债务有史以来最大的月度流入量。【原文：Foreign investors expanded their purchases of lira-denominated Turkish government bonds last week, notching the biggest monthly inflow into the country’s domestic debt on record.】

item.title: 据说伊贝尔德罗拉公司将考虑以 18 亿美元出售美国可再生能源资产
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，伊贝尔德罗拉公司（Iberdrola SA）正在寻找投资者，以高达 18 亿美元的价格购买美国可再生能源资产组合的股份。【原文：Iberdrola SA is looking for an investor to buy a stake in a portfolio of US renewable-energy assets for as much as $1.8 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 斯洛文尼亚为银行救援索赔开辟道路
item.description: 斯洛文尼亚议会批准了一项法律，允许投资者就十多年前拯救金融业时遭受的损失向法院寻求赔偿。【原文：Slovenia’s parliament approved a law allowing investors to seek compensation in court for losses incurred in a rescue of the financial sector more than a decade ago.】

item.title: 日本央行上田表示 GDP 下降对政策路径影响不大
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫（Kazuo Ueda）表示，今年经济开局不佳不会促使央行放弃加息，因为预计经济会出现反弹。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda indicated that the economy’s poor start to the year won’t push the central bank from a path of hiking interest rates because a growth rebound is anticipated.】

item.title: <strong>1800 亿美元刺激政府开支的计划正适得其反</strong
item.description:
由于十多年前联邦预算的削减，州和城市正在对债券进行再融资，这引起了投资者的不满。【原文：

States and cities are refinancing bonds and causing investor ire because of federal budget cuts more than a decade ago. 

】

item.title: 德意志银行前首席执行官罗尔夫-布劳尔逝世，享年 86 岁
item.description: 德意志银行前首席执行官兼董事长罗尔夫-布劳尔（Rolf E. Breuer）去世。享年 86 岁。【原文：Rolf E. Breuer, former chief executive and chairman of Deutsche Bank AG, has died. He was 86.】

item.title: 马克龙称欧洲需要 "更大胆的货币政策
item.description: 法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙再次呼吁欧洲中央银行制定 "更大胆的货币政策"，将增长和创造就业作为目标。【原文：French President Emmanuel Macron called anew for a “bolder monetary policy” mandate for the European Central Bank that includes growth and job creation as targets.】

item.title: 对冲基金蚕食中国金属市场主导地位
item.description:
由于需求下降，中等收入国家的中心地位日渐削弱，具有长远眼光的资产管理公司的影响力正在增强。【原文：

As the Middle Kingdom becomes less central because of declining demand, asset managers with a longer-term view are gaining influence.

】

item.title: 大众汽车考虑放慢电池生产速度以应对电动汽车市场下滑
item.description: 随着欧洲电动汽车销售的降温，大众汽车公司可能会加快其即将在欧洲建成的电池工厂的满负荷生产速度。【原文：Volkswagen AG may push out how quickly its upcoming battery factories in Europe reach full capacity as EV sales across the region cool.】

item.title: 莫迪在甘地 "非暴力抵抗 "的土地上获胜面临农场焦虑和失业的威胁
item.description: 每天，彭博社记者都会带您走过精选的城镇和城市，为大选投票做准备。【原文：Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.】

item.title: Segantii 对冲基金因内幕交易指控而关闭
item.description: 西蒙-赛德勒（Simon Sadler）的对冲基金正在向投资者返还资金，这标志着该公司在香港监管机构指控其进行内幕交易后戛然而止。【原文：Simon Sadler’s hedge fund is returning capital to investors, marking an abrupt end for the firm after regulators in Hong Kong accused it of insider trading.】

item.title: 瑞士议会将于 12 月公布瑞士信贷报告
item.description: 瑞士议会负责审查瑞士信贷倒闭事件的委员会周四在一份声明中说，该委员会将于 12 月公布其报告。【原文：The Swiss parliament’s commission reviewing the collapse of Credit Suisse will publish its report in December, it said in a statement on Thursday.】

item.title: 市场策略师开始博弈英国大选前景
item.description: 随着英国大选的落定，投资者正在权衡新政府可能带来的影响，并寻找交易方法。【原文：With the UK election now set, investors are weighing up the possible implications of a new government and looking for ways to trade it.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行测试与 60 多亿美元贷款相关的 SRT 需求
item.description: 桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）正在就超过 60 亿美元贷款的潜在合成风险转移交易征求意见，这些贷款与墨西哥和巴西的汽车制造商和其他借款人有关。【原文：Banco Santander SA is sounding out interest for potential synthetic-risk-transfer transactions linked to more than $6 billion in loans, which are tied to carmakers and other borrowers in Mexico and Brazil.】

item.title: 英国临时大选让房地产市场沸腾起来
item.description: 本周在利兹举行的一次会议上，受高利率、持续通胀和规划瓶颈的影响，房地产投资者们又想到了一个紧迫的新话题：7 月份的大选。【原文：Bruised by high rates, sticky inflation and planning bottlenecks, real estate investors at a conference in Leeds this week had a pressing new topic on their minds: a snap election in July.】

item.title: 印度央行派发红利，空头回补，印度股市创收盘纪录
item.description: 印度主要股票基准周四收盘创下历史新高，此前印度央行向政府派发了丰厚的红利，而且市场对正在进行的大选结果持乐观态度，这令多头情绪高涨。【原文：India’s main equity benchmarks closed at a new all-time high Thursday after the central bank’s bumper dividend to the government and optimism about the outcome of the ongoing general elections energized bulls.】

item.title: 印度最大航空公司因运力增加而实现超预期利润
item.description: 由于印度最大的航空公司受益于运力的提升，IndiGo 第四季度利润超出预期。【原文：IndiGo’s fourth-quarter profit beat estimates as India’s largest carrier benefited from a boost to capacity.】
